text: The 1978 LPGA Championship was the 24th LPGA Championship, held June 8–11 at Jack Nicklaus Golf Center at Kings Island in Mason, Ohio, a suburb northeast of Cincinnati. Nancy Lopez, a 21-year-old tour rookie, won the first of her three major titles, all at the LPGA Championship at Kings Island. She finished at 275 (−13), six strokes ahead of runner-up It was the sixth tour win for Lopez and her fourth consecutive in and she won the following week to run the streak to five. This was the first of twelve consecutive LPGA Championships at Kings Island; the last one in 1989 was also won by Lopez. ==Past champions in the field== ===Made the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || R3 || R4 || Total || To par || Finish |- | align=left|Chako Higuchi || align=left| || 1977 || 75 || 73 || 69 || 73 || 290 || +2 || 14 |- | align=left|Gloria Ehret || align=left| || 1966 || 72 || 72 || 78 || 70 || 292 || +4 || T17 |- |align=left|Kathy Ahern || align=left| || 1972 || 71 || 75 || 72 || 75 || 293 || +5 || T25 |- | align=left|Sandra Post || align=left| || 1968 || 74 || 72 || 73 || 74 || 293 || +5 || T25 |- |align=left|Mickey Wright || align=left| || 1958, 1960, 1961, 1963 || 69 || 82 || 73 || 69 || 293 || +5 || T25 |- | align=left|Kathy Whitworth || 67 71 75 align=left| || 1967, 1971, 1975 || 73 || 76 || 73 || 73 || 295 || +7 || T33 |- | align=left|Betty Burfeindt || align=left| || 1976 || 73 || 77 || 73 || 74 || 297 || +9 || 44 |- |} Source: ===Missed the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || Total || To par |- | align=left|Marlene Hagge || align=left| || 1956 || 75 || 78 || 153 || +9 |- | align=left|Judy Kimball || align=left| || 1962 || 76 || 78 || 154 || +10 |- | align=left|Shirley Englehorn || align=left| || 1970 || 79 || 76 || 155 || +11 |- | align=left|Mary Mills || align=left| || 1964, 1973 || 80 || 79 || 159 || +15 |- | align=left|Louise Suggs || align=left| || 1957 || 82 || 82 || 164 || +20 |} Source: ==Final leaderboard== Sunday, June 11, 1978 {|class="wikitable" !
